Mythical.name: PREACOGDO
Mythical.Use: Grants the user the ability to peer into the future, past, or present, related to themselves to a certain extent. Upon consumption, the rest of the fruit vanishes, and the user cannot gain an ability from another fruit of a similar nature and is unable to touch purified water.
Mythical.Preparation: Eating (one bite makes the rest vanish)

Mythical.name: PROBODO
Mythical.Use: Grants the user the ability to alter their own probability to an extent. Upon consumption, the rest of the fruit vanishes, and the user cannot gain an ability from another fruit of a similar nature and is unable to touch purified water.
Mythical.Preparation: Eating (one bite makes the rest vanish)

Mythical.name: LIGHTONSUNDO
Mythical.Use: Grants the ability to create and control light around the user at will, making it tangible or fluid and manipulating it, including as bursts of light. Also grants a large increase in speed, the ability to fly (body weighs nothing), travel through sources of light (moving through reflections), and make the body completely transparent or change how others see it, granting limited illusion creation. Upon consumption, the rest of the fruit vanishes, and the user cannot gain an ability from another fruit of a similar nature and is unable to touch purified water.
Mythical.Preparation: Eating (one bite makes the rest vanish)

Mythical.name: ETERNA BLOOM
Mythical.Use: Grants immortality by constantly regenerating the user's body on a cellular level, making them ageless and immune to diseases or injuries. It must be consumed in its entirety for the effect to work, though it is said to come with a heavy price.

Mythical.name: WEIGHDO
Mythical.Use: Grants the ability to alter the weight of their body from anywhere between 1 to 100,000 kilograms at will. Upon consumption, the rest of the fruit vanishes, and the user cannot gain an ability from another fruit of a similar nature and is unable to touch purified water.
Mythical.Preparation: Eating (one bite makes the rest vanish)

Mythical.name: SPIRTDDO
Mythical.Use: Grants the ability to communicate with the spirits that linger in the land of the souls, being able to not only see them but also be on friendly terms with non-hostile spirits. The user is more prone to being helped by spirits and can interact with the land of the spirits (speak, touch). The user can also allow a spirit to temporarily possess their body at their own risk. Upon consumption, the rest of the fruit vanishes, and the user cannot gain an ability from another fruit of a similar nature and is unable to touch purified water.
Mythical.Preparation: Eating (one bite makes the rest vanish)

Mythical.name: ZELIODD
Mythical.Use: Grants the ability to turn their body into a hive of small holes and from these holes, create swarms of insects (common or lower-ranked fauna insects with a queen). The user can create an almost infinite number as long as they have the mana and mass to sustain it, as each insect created takes away from their mass. The user will also not die as long as one of the insects remains, reforming their body from the insect but losing all strength, abilities, and capabilities aside from the fruit itself. Upon consumption, the rest of the fruit vanishes, and the user cannot gain an ability from another fruit of a similar nature and is unable to touch purified water.
Mythical.Preparation: Eating (one bite makes the rest vanish)

Legendary.name: INTAGADO
Legendary.Use: Grants the user the ability to completely make their body intangible from physical, magical, and even soul-related matters. In this form, however, they also can't do anything and cannot move. Upon consumption, the rest of the fruit vanishes, and the user cannot gain an ability from another fruit of a similar nature and is unable to touch purified water.
Legendary.Preparation: Eating (one bite makes the rest vanish)

Legendary.name: MASHDO
Legendary.Use: Grants the ability to create and manipulate a type of soft, marshmallow-like material at will that is able to absorb the impact of things. If it touches water, it also absorbs it and expands. Upon consumption, the rest of the fruit vanishes, and the user cannot gain an ability from another fruit of a similar nature and is unable to touch purified water.
Legendary.Preparation: Eating (one bite makes the rest vanish)

Legendary.name: BARRIERDO
Legendary.Use: Grants the ability to create and manipulate a semi-transparent barrier at will. Upon consumption, the rest of the fruit vanishes, and the user cannot gain an ability from another fruit of a similar nature and is unable to touch purified water.
Legendary.Preparation: Eating (one bite makes the rest vanish)

Legendary.name: AGIDO
Legendary.Use: Grants the ability to use their age as a weapon. Upon eating the fruit, the user gains the ability to use their lifespan as a means to gain strength, and for every year of their lifespan that they burn, they will gain a temporary boost in power. This change physically and mentally affects them, as their body changes to show their change in lifespan. Upon consumption, the rest of the fruit vanishes, and the user cannot gain an ability from another fruit of a similar nature and is unable to touch purified water.
Legendary.Preparation: Eating (one bite makes the rest vanish)

Legendary.name: READO
Legendary.Use: Grants the user the ability to resurrect upon death once. However, the time it takes for them can be anywhere between 1 hour to 1 year; as such, the state their body is in when they resurrect depends on the time past. Upon consumption, the rest of the fruit vanishes, and the user cannot gain an ability from another fruit of a similar nature and is unable to touch purified water.
Legendary.Preparation: Eating (one bite makes the rest vanish)

Legendary.name: PHOENIX BLOOM
Legendary.Use: Holds the power of resurrection and rebirth, allowing the person that inhales the burnt ashes of the flower to return from death with a new body. The user must have died within the past month, and the resurrection will bring them back to life with full health but drained mana.
Legendary.Location: Volcano and Firelands (believed to form where a large number of Phoenixes die over hundreds of years; no two flowers form in the same area)
Legendary.Preparation: Must be burned and ashes must be consumed (inhaled).
Legendary.Additional Notes:
Link: N/A (Link not provided in source text)
________________

Legendary.name: ENLIGHTENMENT
Legendary.Use: This plant is able to answer 3 questions the user has in their mind.
Legendary.Location: Forest (only grows within dense magical areas, randomly)
Legendary.Preparation: Grinding

Legendary.name: Crystal Apple
Legendary.Use: This fruit is said to absorb the essence of any living thing around it, including mana, and fuse it into itself. This gives the fruit the ability to boost the ability of anything that eats it, equivalent to how much it has absorbed. It is near impossible to find.
Legendary.Preparation: None.

Legendary.name: PLANDO
Legendary.Use: Grants the ability to create and control plants at will, being able to even change their body into a completely nature form that is akin to a plant. Upon consumption, the rest of the fruit vanishes, and the user cannot gain an ability from another fruit of a similar nature and is unable to touch purified water.
Legendary.Preparation: Eating (one bite makes the rest vanish)

Legendary.name: MAGMADO
Legendary.Use: Grants the ability to create and control magma at will. Upon consumption, the rest of the fruit vanishes, and the user cannot gain an ability from another fruit of a similar nature and is unable to touch purified water.
Legendary.Preparation: Eating (one bite makes the rest vanish)

Legendary.name: ICEDO
Legendary.Use: Grants the ability to create and control ice. Upon consumption, the rest of the fruit vanishes, and the user cannot gain an ability from another fruit of a similar nature and is unable to touch purified water.
Legendary.Preparation: Eating (one bite makes the rest vanish)

Legendary.name: LIGHTNINDO
Legendary.Use: Grants the ability to create lightning from their body and use it as a form of attack. Also grants the user enhanced speed and the ability to heal themselves by absorbing lightning. Upon consumption, the rest of the fruit vanishes, and the user cannot gain an ability from another fruit of a similar nature and is unable to touch purified water.
Legendary.Preparation: Eating (one bite makes the rest vanish)

Legendary.name: MAGNODO
Legendary.Use: Grants the user the ability to control magnetic objects within a certain range of them within limits. Upon consumption, the rest of the fruit vanishes, and the user cannot gain an ability from another fruit of a similar nature and is unable to touch purified water.
Legendary.Preparation: Eating (one bite makes the rest vanish)

Legendary.name: SHUDDO
Legendary.Use: Grants the user the ability to control shadows around them at will, even making them tangible. Upon consumption, the rest of the fruit vanishes, and the user cannot gain an ability from another fruit of a similar nature and is unable to touch purified water.
Legendary.Preparation: Eating (one bite makes the rest vanish)

Legendary.name: BLESSED ROSE
Legendary.Use: When consumed, it grants the user an enhanced healing factor that can heal injuries much faster than normal, being able to heal a person 15x faster than a normal human for 5 turns. The flower's nectar can be used to create a healing potion with lesser effectivity. Consuming too much nectar can cause disorientation and dizziness.
Legendary.Location: Forests, Mountains, and Plains. Only blooms once every ten years in specific regions.
Legendary.Preparation: Must be consumed (petals can be eaten raw, nectar is most potent).

Legendary.name: NECROTIC BLOSSOM
Legendary.Use: Has the power to summon the dead even in its flowery form, constantly making undead zombies and skeletons around it to protect itself (up to 50 at a time). It dies upon leaving its dirt and constantly attacks.
Legendary.Location: Grows exclusively in Graveyards, Tombs, and Crypts in certain conditions.
Legendary.Preparation: None (dies when removed from dirt, difficult to reach/harvest due to constant attacks)

Legendary.name: MYSTIKK FRUIT
Legendary.Use: Consuming one grants/increases the user's elemental affinity (for the fruit's element: Water, Ice, Fire, Nature, Wind, Earth, Dark, Light) by 40%-80%. Does not work for those with already high elemental affinity (4X or above). Consuming fruits within a week of each other decreases elemental affinity. Each time a fruit of the same affinity is eaten, the amount gained decreases.
Legendary.Location: Certain kinds only grow in certain climates: Fire & Earth (Desert), Wind & Light (Mountains), Dark (Caves), Nature (Forests), Water (Oceans), Ice (Tundra).
Legendary.Preparation: Must be consumed.

Legendary.name: TELEABLOOM
Legendary.Use: When chewed, it allows the user to teleport to any location that they have previously visited, as long as they have a clear image of that place in mind. It works regardless of distance or obstacles, as long as something magical isn't preventing it.
Legendary.Location: Unknown (grows randomly, teleports to a new place every few days)
Legendary.Preparation: Must be chewed.

Legendary.name: LUMINOUS NIGHTSHADE
Legendary.Use: Grants the consumer enhanced light and dark powers, providing a 10% Resistance and 15% Affinity for Light and Dark (depending on the cherry eaten). Eating large amounts grants the ability to control either light or darkness within a limited range. Should be consumed with caution by those without sufficient mastery over their powers due to adverse effects (overwhelming bursts of light/darkness).
Legendary.Location: Grows in special dark and bright places.
Legendary.Preparation: Must be consumed.

Legendary.name: PHYSPHER
Legendary.Use: When prepared and consumed, it turns the user intangible for 2 turns. Highly reactive with combustion, as it must be consumed while on fire for the effect to occur (fumes alone do not work).
Legendary.Location: Grows underground inside highly magically potent crystalline structures or rocks, like magic geodes.
Legendary.Preparation: Remove flowers from stalk. Separate the leaves and burn when eating.

Legendary.name: GORGAN'S TALE
Legendary.Use: The purple edges of the petals are extremely dangerous; biting them causes the target to slowly start turning to stone (from outside in), a process taking 10 days with little known cure. The inner green part of the petals, once consumed, can cure most poisons, including its own petrification effect.
Legendary.Location: None (implied to be very rare or specific to certain conditions, as the region is "None")
Legendary.Preparation: Very carefully cutting (to separate dangerous purple from curative green).
Legendary.Cost: 35 Gold for the green part; purple not sold.

Legendary.name: Autymopal
Legendary.Use: The honey-like center is edible and often bottled in Chusei to be used as various syrups or honeys. Its leaves, when burned for one minute, leave a smell repulsive to mana entities, making them prized by religious entities for warding off spirits or harmful mana entities. Placing the flower (without its gooey interior) on a grave in Chusei is a sign of respect and community recognition.
Legendary.Location: Indigenous to Chusei only (grows on trees).
Legendary.Preparation: Honey-like center is scooped out and boiled with various liquids to create various tasting syrups. Leaves are to be burned for one minute.

Rare.name: ELECTRICORAL
Rare.Use: At night, it creates a visible field of electricity around it, creating a safe haven for fishy fauna. When consumed (leaves brewed into liquid), it allows the consumer to control blasts of electricity for 10 turns, but in turn, they are much weaker to fire spells.
Rare.Location: Oceans, Coral Reefs (Fantails, found in the reefs of The Grand Blue).
Rare.Preparation: Leaves must be brewed into liquid.

Rare.name: REEF TICKLER
Rare.Use: When prepared properly, it grants the consumer an 80% reduction in the effectiveness of D Rank and below toxins or poisons for 5 turns. It is also important for the continued survival of coral reefs.
Rare.Preparation: Boiled into liquid, similar to nettle or saffron.

Rare.name: GENDO
Rare.Use: Grants the user the ability to change their own gender at will, without a time limit, and also the gender of others they touch for a limited time. Upon consumption, the rest of the fruit vanishes, and the user cannot gain an ability from another fruit of a similar nature and is unable to touch purified water.
Rare.Preparation: Eating (one bite makes the rest vanish)

Rare.name: SANDO
Rare.Use: Grants the ability to create and control sand at will. Upon consumption, the rest of the fruit vanishes, and the user cannot gain an ability from another fruit of a similar nature and is unable to touch purified water.
Rare.Preparation: Eating (one bite makes the rest vanish)

Rare.name: SMOKDO
Rare.Use: Grants the ability to create and control smoke at will. Upon consumption, the rest of the fruit vanishes, and the user cannot gain an ability from another fruit of a similar nature and is unable to touch purified water.
Rare.Preparation: Eating (one bite makes the rest vanish)

Rare.name: SPIAKDO
Rare.Use: Grants the user the ability to create and shoot out spikes from their body at will. Upon consumption, the rest of the fruit vanishes, and the user cannot gain an ability from another fruit of a similar nature and is unable to touch purified water.
Rare.Preparation: Eating (one bite makes the rest vanish)

Rare.name: SUNNDO
Rare.Use: Grants the user the ability to create and control a type of yellowish flames at will. Upon consumption, the rest of the fruit vanishes, and the user cannot gain an ability from another fruit of a similar nature and is unable to touch purified water.
Rare.Preparation: Eating (one bite makes the rest vanish)

Rare.name: GUMMDO
Rare.Use: Grants the user the ability to create and control a type of sticky gummy-like substance at will. Upon consumption, the rest of the fruit vanishes, and the user cannot gain an ability from another fruit of a similar nature and is unable to touch purified water.
Rare.Preparation: Eating (one bite makes the rest vanish)

Rare.name: FURUSHIN LACORAGI
Rare.Use: Once the gel of the plant is stirred into a tea and consumed, it cures almost all common and uncommon fevers.
Rare.Location: Desert - Oasis's (found in deep desert Oasis's, away from civilization; hard to grow in farms).
Rare.Preparation: Peel off the main skin layer to reveal the gel underneath. Stir the gel in hot water to make a tea.

Rare.name: FANTASIAFRUIT
Rare.Use: Bestows those who consume it with extremely vivid hallucinogenic visions for 5 turns. It also ensures the consumer is unable to feel pain and has regeneration boosted by 10X for as long as they are hallucinating.
Rare.Location: Forests (found in the heart of forests hanging from only the tallest trees).
Rare.Preparation: The leaves and their stems must be cut off, and the fruit itself must be eaten whole.

Rare.name: FALSE ENLIGHTENMENT
Rare.Use: When consumed, it becomes a powerful hallucinogenic, giving the user powerful and realistic hallucinations.
Rare.Preparation: Grinding

Rare.name: GHOST LILY
Rare.Use: When consumed raw, it imbues the user with a temporary invisibility that lasts for 10 turns, hiding them from normal sight and mana-sensing abilities. The user's footsteps, movements, scents, and sounds will also be silenced. Consumption of multiple lilies in a short period can lead to prolonged and dangerous invisibility, potentially leading to madness.
Rare.Location: Dark Caves and Crypts (grows in the darkest and most shadowed parts).
Rare.Preparation: Must be consumed raw. (Recommended to wait at least a day between consumptions).

Rare.name: DARKHEART FLOWER
Rare.Use: Passively projects an aura of evil and malevolence onto anything nearby, stronger for those who have committed more evil. When consumed, its potent essence can imbue the user with the power of evil projection for 10 turns, allowing them to project a powerful, malevolent aura that instills fear and despair in enemies, weakening them.
Rare.Location: Underground caves and tunnels (found where death has taken place).
Rare.Preparation: Can be consumed.

Rare.name: XYX-LOMING
Rare.Use: Causes the consumer to undergo self-multiplication, allowing their body to split into 4 different clones. Clones last for 15 turns, possessing the same skills, knowledge, and physical capabilities as the original, but no mana or magical capabilities. After clones disappear, the consumer feels weakened and exhausted and needs time to recover.
Rare.Location: Forests, Jungles, and other areas with dense vegetation filled with clean mana.
Rare.Preparation: The flower must be consumed in its raw form.

Rare.name: THORNSTRIKE
Rare.Use: Its leaves and thorns contain a potent venom that can induce excruciating pain and numbness. When brewed as a tea, it can grant the drinker the ability to inflict intense pain on others that touch them, but comes at the price of also feeling that pain themselves.
Rare.Location: Swampland (found in the shallow waters of the corrupted swamplands).
Rare.Preparation: Must be brewed as a tea.

Rare.name: BEASTBERRY
Rare.Use: Infused with the essence of wild animals, giving the consumer temporary access to a limited version of that animal's powers for 20 turns. Each berry is specific to a certain animal, and powers depend on the animal (e.g., wolf: enhanced senses/strength; bird: temporary flight/sharper vision). After use, the person is unable to use it again for 25 turns.
Rare.Location: Various, found near areas with high animal activity.
Rare.Preparation: Must be consumed.

Rare.name: MYSTIC TREE
Rare.Use: Each part of the tree can be used in different ways. Leaves can be eaten to replenish lost mana little by little, and the wood is useful for crafting, especially for wizards and alchemists, as it conducts mana exceptionally well.
Rare.Location: Anywhere with a high amount of mana (takes thousands of years to absorb enough mana).
Rare.Preparation: Leaves can be eaten; wood used for crafting.

Rare.name: HEAVEN OR HELL KEEPER
Rare.Use: Has two different colored petals depending on the time of day.
Rare.Preparation: Boiling (depending on petal color).
Rare.Cost: Blue petals can be sold for up to 9 Gold; purple petals are illegal.
Rare.Legality: Purple petals are Illegal. Blue petals are N/A.
Rare.Additional Notes:
* Blue petals (day): If boiled, act as a very good antidote to most common, uncommon, and few rare poisons.
* Purple petals (night): If boiled, will make the consumer extremely sick, on par with that of a rare poison.
________________
(not tagged in the site)

Rare.name: Snow's Grace
Rare.Use: A freezing cold flower that will cause anything it touches to freeze solid. It has the special ability to freeze anything in order to preserve it in that state, forever.
Rare.Location: Frozen Tundra (grows only in the coldest parts, extremely difficult to find and harvest).
Rare.Preparation: None.

Rare.name: Kraken's Bell
Rare.Use: A carnivorous plant that entangles prey with tentacles and digests them. The acid juice inside its bell-shaped flower can be diluted and boiled to make a medicine that cures diseases related to the digestive system. The tentacles, when roasted or fried, taste like squid and are highly nutritious.
Rare.Location: Corrupted Swamp (mutated after the swamp became corrupted).
Rare.Preparation: The acid juice requires dilution and boiling. The tentacles can be roasted or fried. Harvesting requires cutting its stem.

Rare.name: Zombud
Rare.Use: A poisonous flora that subsists off dead creatures and is a carrier of disease. Its buds release poisonous clouds that can be lethal in moderate amounts. Small amounts can cause death over weeks, while higher amounts can kill in a few days. The effects of the poison include nausea, dizziness, weakened muscularity, and blood clotting.
Rare.Location: Cemeteries, battlefields, or areas where corpses are potent (often grows underground or crawls through fields of dead).
Rare.Preparation: N/A (Poisonous)

Rare.name: Grim-Fun
Rare.Use: When unprepared, its spores induce blood clotting, numbness, dizziness, and in high volumes, liver failure. If encountered underwater, it can also cause hallucinations, potentially leading to drowning. When prepared properly, its lethal effects are removed, and it becomes similar to psychedelic shrooms.
Rare.Location: Corrupted Swamp (grows in murky areas, up to 20 meters tall).
Rare.Preparation: Remove stalk skins, wash well, then boil for 25 minutes.

Rare.name: Curmona
Rare.Use: This plant is dangerous to most living things; it can blend into the environment, and if "bitten" by it, the victim becomes extremely sick shortly after. The only way to cure this sickness is to destroy the plant.
Rare.Preparation: None.

Rare.name: Golden Cherry
Rare.Use: Eating these cherries is said to reduce the cooldown of magic by 3 turns for a period of 5 turns. They are believed to be infused with mana directly.
Rare.Preparation: None.

Rare.name: Felmather (not sure if extremely rare is rare or rare+)
Rare.Use: The leaves of this plant, when placed under the tongue of a person in a coma, can cause the person to awake in 10-18 turns if successful.
Rare.Preparation: None (leaves are placed under the tongue).

Rare.name: Entriste
Rare.Use: Entriste's leaves absorb liquid and, when crushed, may be used to draw 100% of poison from a wound if applied within 5 turns of insinuative poisoning. It causes pain and does not work against gases or "instant-death" poisons. (1 leaf absorbs a quarter-pint of liquid).
Rare.Preparation: Grind / None (leaves are crushed and applied).

Rare.name: Edram
Rare.Use: When eaten, this plant will cause bones to heal at 1.5 times their normal rate for a period of 3 turns.
Rare.Preparation: None.

Rare.name: Dragonwort
Rare.Use: The root of this herb, when prepared, should be drunk by people with smallpox and the plague in order to effect a cure.
Rare.Preparation: The root should be boiled over a low heat for three days.
Rare.Cost: 1 gold (value increases greatly in times of plague).

Rare.name: Aldaka
Rare.Use: If used successfully (roots brewed over a low fire for one week and the resulting distillation drunk), sight will be restored to the recipient, provided the eye remains.
Rare.Preparation: The roots must be brewed over a low fire for one week.

Rare.name: Asarabacca
Rare.Use: When its flowers are brewed on a fire and left to stand, and then administered successfully, it will render the recipient docile and unable to become violent. This effect can be negated by extreme force of will.
Rare.Preparation: Grounded or boiled. The flowers must be brewed on a fire and left to stand.

Rare.name: Suaeysit
Rare.Use: These mushrooms give the consumer a rush of energy, clearing the mind and raising the spirits. They are often used to counteract shock in emergency situations. However, they are highly addictive, requiring careful preparation and dosage.
Rare.Location: Arctic (grows in shadowed forests in cool to cold climes).
Rare.Preparation: 0-1 week (can be eaten directly or dried and ground into tinctures or otherwise prepared).

Rare.name: White bryony
Rare.Use: The root of this plant, when ground up and boiled in water and drunk, acts as a cure for pneumonia.
Rare.Preparation: Ground and boiled. The root can be ground up and boiled in water.

Rare.name: Wolfsbane
Rare.Use: The root, when boiled in water and applied to a bite from a venomous creature within 15 minutes, will reduce the damage caused by the venom by half. Wolfsbane is also poisonous to werewolves and beastmen; upon contact with their skin, it burns them, and if digested, it is extremely poisonous and can kill if not treated quickly.
Rare.Preparation: 1 day. The root must be boiled in water and then applied.

Rare.name: Man-Eater
Rare.Use: Upon getting close, this plant comes alive, revealing rows of teeth to grind apart anything. Its vines can entangle and capture anyone nearby.
Rare.Location: Forested areas (found rarely, commonly during summer).
Rare.Preparation: None.

Rare.name: Prota
Rare.Use: This flower has the ability to grant whoever is holding it protection from anything with "ill intention" for up to 5 turns. After the turns are up, it withers to dust.
Rare.Preparation: None.

Rare.name: Eyetic
Rare.Use: When the root of the plant is boiled and drunk, the person is able to see things that are invisible ("see that which is unseeable").
Rare.Preparation: Boiling (the root).

Rare.name: Purfic
Rare.Use: This plant can cure any form of taint to the body. It can heal all wounds (besides fatal), cure any poison, remove any curse, get rid of any tumor, infection, cancer, or anything. It is considered the absolute best cure.
Rare.Location: Anywhere (grows absolutely anywhere once a year).
Rare.Preparation: Boiling it in water and then drinking the water.

Rare.name: Fury Flower
Rare.Use: Once boiled and consumed, this flower gives the drinker absolute resistance to all levels of fire/heat for the next 4 turns.
Rare.Preparation: Boiling.

Rare.name: Atamale
Rare.Use: The scent this flower gives off attracts nearby creatures. By cutting out a piece of it, you can also attract creatures near that piece, though the effects are weakened.
Rare.Preparation: None.

Rare.name: Ex-Scrom
Rare.Use: This plant seemingly has a mind of its own, commonly able to grab prey with its vine-like arms and spray a sleeping powder on them.
Rare.Preparation: None.

Rare.name: White Death
Rare.Use: An extremely poisonous plant; whoever ingests its ground dust will submit to an extremely high fever and other symptoms.
Rare.Preparation: Grinding.

Rare.name: Colorful Death
Rare.Use: The multiple colored petals of this plant, when boiled together, can result in a very potent poison that causes the drinker to get progressively sicker until they eventually fall into a coma.
Rare.Preparation: Boiling.

Uncommon.name: BLAST POLYPS
Uncommon.Use: If the top anemones are plucked, the spikes can be easily removed and applied. Once applied to the body (via acupuncture), the spikes numb pain, making the user completely unfeeling to it for a day. However, after the day, the user feels all the pain at once, potentially leading to a coma if they cannot handle it.
Uncommon.Preparation: Spikes must be applied via acupuncture techniques (after plucking top anemones).
Uncommon.Legality: Illegal (selling, growing, and harvesting are crimes).

Uncommon.name: PHALANX FLOWERS
Uncommon.Use: When consumed properly, the fruit allows the consumer to breathe underwater and move 2x as fast underwater for the day. To harvest, one must delicately twist the fruit counter-clockwise, or the plant will explode.
Uncommon.Location: Oceans, Rivers, Lakes (found in large reefs, always in groups of 3 or more).
Uncommon.Preparation: Dunk the fruit into boiling Liquid Mana for 10 minutes, consume when fruit rises to surface.

Uncommon.name: SUNDEW
Uncommon.Use: Gives off a glow when cut. Upon consumption (fruit or juice), the consumer will begin to brightly glow in all directions in a 10-meter range with 3000 lumens, strong enough to blind anyone unprepared nearby (consumer unaffected). Has a refreshing, sweet taste.
Uncommon.Location: Oasis, mountains (grows on large vines in areas where the sun shines brightly and water is nearby).

Uncommon.name: NAPTIME
Uncommon.Use: When consumed, makes the consumer very sleepy. The next time that person goes to sleep, they will have a very peaceful and vivid dream that they will always remember. The person also feels twice as refreshed than if they slept the same amount of time without it. Good for quick rests and needing a peaceful time in the land of dreams.
Uncommon.Location: Lush caves, shaded areas where the moon shines.

Uncommon.name: WATER URANT PLANT
Uncommon.Use: Holds about a gallon of water within its main body, stored over long periods of time.
Uncommon.Location: Desert (found throughout desert plains and rocky areas, primarily void from dunes).

Uncommon.name: DOUBLANA
Uncommon.Use: When eaten, the user will have their number of eyes, arms, and ears doubled allowing them to more effectively see, hear, and grab things in battle. Lasts 5 turns.

Uncommon.name: BOMBIER GRAPES
Uncommon.Use: Can be thrown in a bunch causing them to detonate, making a medium-sized explosion that sends bombier grapes everywhere, which then make small explosions after a few bounces. Single grapes can also be pulled off and thrown, making this fruit a useful weapon.
Uncommon.Location: Plains (grows on vines in areas with unstable mana).

Uncommon.name: GALIGAN'S BANE
Uncommon.Use: Its leaves contain a deadly, nearly undetectable poison that is fatal towards humans with just a sip. This poison doesn't change the color, scent, or taste of whatever drink it is added into.
Uncommon.Preparation: Grind the leaves down into a powder.

Uncommon.name: INSEVENTOL
Uncommon.Use: Produces a venomous liquid in its roots. When roots are crushed, it releases a sweet-smelling sap that attracts insects and weak insect-type faunas, causing them to enter a state of frenzy and attack everything around them. While the venom doesn't work on people or animals, it is illegal due to its potential use.

Uncommon.name: SENTINEL BLOSSOM
Uncommon.Use: Releases a small wave of mana that bounces off everything within 25 meters, returning to the flower. The intensity of the mana depends on the level of danger present, but it is ultimately harmless. Highly valued for its ability to provide a warning against potential threats. Dies once it leaves the dirt.
Uncommon.Location: Mountains, Caves (often found in places with little life or activity).
Uncommon.Preparation: None (hard to harvest as it dies when removed from dirt).

Uncommon.name: GLOWSHROOM
Uncommon.Use: Has the ability to glow in the dark. When boiled with water and consumed, the consumer's eyes will begin to glow in the dark, allowing them to see in complete darkness for 30 turns. The light given off by the eyes may attract unwanted attention.

Uncommon.name: YLLYNIUM
Uncommon.Use: When prepared and applied to Beast Clan races, it temporarily negates the effect of silver burning their skin. This effect lasts for 7 turns where applied. Often used by beast clan soldiers, merchants, and metalworkers.
Uncommon.Location: Lakes & Riverbeds (often in groups of 3 and spread along moderate or small bodies of water).
Uncommon.Preparation: Muddle and simmer for 5 turns. Apply to skin or fur as needed.

Uncommon.name: PINSHIRE
Uncommon.Use: Reduces the effect of daylight to vampires down to 1/3rd the stat debuff rather than half. This effect lasts for 10 turns if properly prepared, and 5 turns if not prepared (pricked by spikes). It also makes the consumer resistant to light, making them immune to flashbangs and 30% more resistant to light magic. Leaves consumer smelling like bad wet dog when the effect is over.
Uncommon.Location: Corrupted Swamp (grows nearby water or mud, but never inside large bodies of water).
Uncommon.Preparation: Interior of spikes muddled together, boiled for 8 turns, simmer for 5 while stirring regularly. Alternatively, being pricked by the spikes to where it breaks the skin has the same effect (half duration).

Uncommon.name: SHINI
Uncommon.Use: Capable of absorbing dirt or grime from a surface. The filth is recycled inside its bulb and spewed back out as perfectly cleaned liquid at a very fast rate. Often used as polish or in plumbing systems to help filter pipes.
Uncommon.Preparation: Squeeze the juices out of the vegetable. Can be boiled for 5 minutes to be safe to eat.

Uncommon.name: Bolker
Uncommon.Use: The lime green viscous goo inside, when rubbed into skin, turns the applied area as hard as stone for 6 turns. However, this halves regeneration on the applied area while active and leaves the area dry with broken skin after the effect ends. The exterior shell is edible but tough, similar to rock candy or watermelon skin.
Uncommon.Location: Mountains, Arid Lands, & Deserts (typically grows near rocks).
Uncommon.Preparation: Crack open the buds (top buds can be twisted and pulled to open easily), remove gooey insides. Rub goo on skin where applicable. The exterior shell is edible.

Uncommon.name: Dyadra
Uncommon.Use: Commonly used to dye things, as their liquids can be used for different color dyes, frequently by tailors. Dyadra can also be dried to have a sweet taste, turning it into candy. If eaten raw, the dye can cause diarrhea or headaches.
Uncommon.Location: Wetlands & nearby rivers (grows under wet ground).
Uncommon.Preparation: Mulched or juiced, then boil liquid remains for 2 minutes. May also be dried.

Uncommon.name: Deadly nightshade
Uncommon.Use: When prepared (berries left to stand in water for a week and the distillation drunk), it will put someone to sleep for 8-12 hours, during which they cannot be woken. There is a 50% chance it will kill them and a 50% chance it will drive them insane.
Uncommon.Preparation: The berries must be left to stand in water for a week, and the distillation drunk (for full potency).
Uncommon.Legality: Preparing and selling nightshade is Illegal.

Uncommon.name: Zur
Uncommon.Use: When successfully brewed for six to seven hours, it will result in doubled perception for an hour. It is slightly addictive.
Uncommon.Preparation: Brew for six to seven hours.

Uncommon.name: Falsifal
Uncommon.Use: When its root is pulped, mixed with water, and used as a poultice, it is effective against fresh burns, aiding rapid healing. The root gel can also be thinned and drunk as a thick tea to counter the effects of blood loss.
Uncommon.Preparation: Takes less than an hour to prepare. The root can be pulped and mixed with water for a poultice, or the root gel thinned for a thick tea.

Uncommon.name: Agrimony
Uncommon.Use: When its dried leaves are boiled in a pint of red wine for five minutes, left to stand for an hour, and then used in a compress on sprains and bruises, a successful application will cure sprains and bruises in half the normal time.
Uncommon.Preparation: Boil dried leaves in a pint of red wine for five minutes, then leave to stand for an hour. Use as a compress.

Uncommon.name: Borage
Uncommon.Use: The dried herb, when boiled in water and the infusion drunk, is used to cure minor fevers such as those caused by chills and influenza. It will relieve the fever in 2-3 hours.
Uncommon.Preparation: 4-5 days. The dried herb should be boiled in water, and the infusion drunk.

Uncommon.name: Barberry
Uncommon.Use: When prepared (ground up in cold water, left to stand, then quickly boiled and drunk), this mixture serves as a cure for liver disorders such as jaundice.
Uncommon.Preparation: 3 hours. Barberries should be ground up in cold water, left to stand in cold water, and then boiled quickly. This mixture should be drunk.
Uncommon.Cost: 15-40 copper (depends on whether it's raw or prepared).

Uncommon.name: Balm
Uncommon.Use: The herb should be boiled and given to women suffering menstrual pains.

Uncommon.name: Pollen Whisper
Uncommon.Use: This plant instantly dies if removed from the ground. It constantly creates and releases orange pollen when something moves near its roots. This pollen can cause whoever inhales it to hear things.

Uncommon.name: Nitebell Mushroom
Uncommon.Use: When eaten, this mushroom provides temporary night vision for 10 turns.
Uncommon.Location: Dark Places (found growing in dark and moist places, requires complete darkness, not easily grown).

Uncommon.name: Angelica
Uncommon.Use: Angelica's root, when prepared, should be drunk to relieve coughs. It merely reduces the amount of coughing and does not cure any disease causing a cough.
Uncommon.Preparation: The root should be boiled in water for an hour.

Uncommon.name: Tamariske
Uncommon.Use: A standard medicine that will cleanse wounds, removing all minor infections.

Uncommon.name: Willow-Herb
Uncommon.Use: The smoke of this herb will keep away snakes (or irritate Snake-people). One dose burns for about five turns.

Uncommon.name: Zulsendra
Uncommon.Use: When this mushroom is eaten, it doubles a person's overall speed for 10 minutes. At the end of that time, the person will be exhausted.
Uncommon.Location: Underground - Rare region(this was written in it ) (never found outside its region; uncommon overall, common within its region).

Uncommon.name: Watire
Uncommon.Use: This plant has the ability to absorb moisture from the area over time and store fresh water in its pouch-like root. This fresh water can then be used by cutting the underneath off.
Uncommon.Location: Desert (or other dry and water-lacking places).

Uncommon.name: Oxshoom
Uncommon.Use: This mushroom-like plant creates breathable air in its pocket bubble on its head. Divers use this plant when found underwater to breathe in the air for a short duration.

Uncommon.name: Pogo
Uncommon.Use: If boiled and the water is consumed, it can cure basic forms of poisons.

Uncommon.name: Weeping Willow
Uncommon.Use: Once this flower is removed from where it originally grew, within ten seconds it turns into a gigantic purple weeping willow tree wherever it is thrown.

Uncommon.name: Flyhigh
Uncommon.Use: Once boiled and consumed, it grants the user temporary wings that allow them to fly. This effect lasts for approximately 20 turns.

Uncommon.name: Blood Lotus
Uncommon.Use: Similar to a Venus flytrap, this plant opens up and swallows nearby creatures to drain their blood for sustenance. It cannot be removed from the ground once grown, or it will instantly die.

Uncommon.name: Devil's Berry
Uncommon.Use: A poisonous berry that, once consumed, can cause high fever and blood vomiting.
Uncommon.Location: Forest (grows on a very short tree that lacks leaves and has dying purple flowers).

Uncommon.name: Joywhisper
Uncommon.Use: The pollen this flower produces, when inhaled, can cause the user to feel a false sense of happiness and joy, often relaxing their mind and body while dulling all senses.

Uncommon.name: Black Stinger
Uncommon.Use: This plant has a sharp tip, and if it cuts a person, even slightly, the person will get a high fever. This plant dies if it is removed from the ground.

Uncommon.name: False Bliss
Uncommon.Use: The flowers of this vine-like plant release pollen that makes anyone who inhales it see illusions of what they desire most. The plant uses this to attract prey and slowly feed off its life force and mana. However, it will instantly die if cut or removed from where it grows.

Common.name: NEKO EARS
Common.Use: Produces music when wind passes over its leaves. When properly consumed (dried), it gives the consumer 2x sight, smell, and more intense emotions for an entire day. If consumed raw, the effects are completely reversed.
Common.Location: Oceans, Rivers, Lakes. Grows over coastal rocks or rocks within caves found underwater, and cannot survive completely submerged.
Common.Preparation: Dry the flowers until left without moisture.
Common.Cost: 2 copper a flower; 10 Copper for an entire plant.

Common.name: KELP BELLS
Common.Use: An essential for underwater exploration, it produces an excess amount of oxygen within its "bell." When consuming pieces, it allows the user to hold their breath for 5x as long as usual.
Common.Location: Oceans, Kelp Forests (grows from the seabed, climbing with long stems).
Common.Legality: Illegal (harvesting and selling are deemed a necessity for underwater exploration and were nearly wiped out from over-farming).

Common.name: CACTI COLONY
Common.Use: These cacti plants hold large storages of water (a colony is actually one plant connected by roots).
Common.Location: Desert (mostly found near Oasis's, primarily void from dunes).

Common.name: SNAPPER
Common.Use: Large carnivorous flora that consume animals and sometimes people. Inside their mouths is a pool of acid, able to quickly dissolve what they eat in a matter of minutes. Can be used similar to bean sprouts, and the head is similar to artichokes.
Common.Preparation: Can be used similar to bean sprouts. Head is similar to artichokes.

Common.name: FALSE-ART
Common.Use: When its core is eaten, it numbs the consumer's nerves entirely for up to 3 turns, making them unable to feel anything along the lines of touch or pain, magic or physical. Behaves like ivy, growing over surrounding vegetables to steal sunlight.
Common.Preparation: Take the leaves off. Cut out the core. Can be eaten raw or prepared like any normal vegetable.

Common.name: Cat-eyes
Common.Use: The stalks are edible. When dried and eaten, they allow the consumer to have night vision for 4 IRP hours. However, this makes their eyes sensitive to brighter lights. Often used by poachers for hunting nocturnal creatures or by people working during the night.
Common.Location: Shallow or murky bodies of water (grows under small or murky bodies of water).
Common.Preparation: Cook stalks for 5 minutes on low heat. Can be smoked as well. Cut into bite-sized pieces.

Common.name: Babzoo
Common.Use: Often called 'Blue Poppers' due to their explosive nature. When a creature moves within a half-meter range, the buds quickly expand and explode with the force of being pelted with a baseball, creating an incredibly loud noise audible up to a quarter mile away. Stalks can be burned into passion fruit-smelling incense, and the buds can be used similar to tomatoes.
Common.Preparation: Stalks can be burned into passion fruit-smelling incense. Buds can be used similar to tomatoes.
Common.Cost: 1 silver per bud, 40 copper per half pound of stalk.

Common.name: Grenaberry
Common.Use: Contains a delectable clear liquid that is innately alcohol potent and often used for alcoholic drinks. The shell is edible but rarely eaten due to its hard exterior. Especially popular in Omnis bars and taverns.
Common.Preparation: Remove the leaves. Sharply pull the stem out in one smooth tug. When the stem comes out with the seed core, drain the inside; the liquid can be saved for later.

Common.name: Poelh
Common.Use: Gives off a luminosity from releasing pollen. When prepared, its leaves become very absorbent to water, similar to thin sponges, and are often used as wraps for juicy foods. They taste like sweeter cabbage when prepared (bitter when raw). Often used at funerals in the human clan.
Common.Location: Any body of water (floats on the surface).
Common.Preparation: Dice the leaves and boil them for 7-10 minutes. Take the leaves out and let them dry.

Common.name: Dreshoom
Common.Use: When a bunch of these mushrooms are boiled together with salt and consumed, they will change the attire of the drinker to anything they own, including magical things. Dreshooms are also dangerous if they overpopulate, as they suck out nutrients from their environment.
Common.Location: Forest (grows all over, sticking to large sources of nutrition).

Common.name: Wee Fruit
Common.Use: The plumpy bud is edible right after picking, tasting like a mix between an orange, apple, and mango. When completely juiced, it gives excess energy, similar to a healthy decaffeinated energy drink. The reddish flowers also glow.
Common.Location: Forest (found near the roots of tall trees, commonly in the dark).

Common.name: Fire Berry
Common.Use: An extremely bitter berry that, when eaten, burns the user's mouth like pepper.

Common.name: Weed
Common.Use: The leaves of this plant can be smoked in order to grant a relaxing pleasure to the user.

Common.name: Cokecane
Common.Use: A flower that can be ground up and sniffed to induce an illusion of bliss to the user.

Common.name: Popono
Common.Use: A very small flower that tastes like buttery popcorn. It has no other known abilities.

Common.name: Lightsway
Common.Use: Once picked, this flower lights up a path going to wherever the picker needs to go most (can take them to places, not people).
Common.Cost: Unsold (unable to be sold or kept once picked).

Common.name: Seeee
Common.Use: When prepared (grinded), it can increase sight by 50 meters for up to 2 hours.

Common.name: Glow Plant
Common.Use: This plant constantly glows, providing light for dark places and serving as an easy alternative to electric lights. Adventurers often break off its glowing sticks to use as glow sticks, which can last up to 5 hours once detached.

Common.name: Wetalu
Common.Use: When its petals are burnt, this flower releases a sweet fragrance that makes anyone who smells it more open-minded, relaxed, woozy, or high. It is commonly prescribed by doctors for relaxation and recuperation.
Common.Location: Anywhere that can sustain the growth of plant life.

Common.name: Vervain
Common.Use: A potent herb and a vampire's most well-known weakness. If a vampire makes physical contact with Vervain in any form, it will burn them. If a vampire ingests Vervain, their throat and digestive tract will be burned, and they will become feverish and extremely weak.

Common.name: Yarrow
Common.Use: When its crushed small white flowers are applied to wounds, it will stop minor bleeding and reduce major bleeding to a minor level. A second application can then be used to stop the remaining minor bleeding.
Common.Preparation: Crush the flowers and apply to wounds.

Common.name: Shepherd's Purse
Common.Use: If applied to wounds, it will stop their bleeding for one hour and temporarily removes the need to bandage.

Common.name: Aloe
Common.Use: When the leaf of Aloe is applied to a wound, it will double the natural healing rate of burns and minor cuts.

Common.name: Ash
Common.Use: The bark of the ash tree, when prepared, should be drunk as a cure for fevers, especially those caused by diseases such as malaria. It brings the fever under control within hours but does not cure the underlying cause.
Common.Preparation: The bark must be stripped from its branches and boiled in clear water for one day.

Common.name: Culkas
Common.Use: Each application of Culkas will cure one square foot of sunburn.
